subject: Announce: JDepend 2.1
msgSnippet: JDepend 2.1, the freely-available Java package dependency analyzer, is now available with the following minor bug fixes: - When parsing class files, constant
messageBody:
JDepend 2.1, the freely-available Java package dependency analyzer, is
now available with the following minor bug fixes:

- When parsing class files, constant pool entries that refer to array
types are now parsed properly. Previous to this fix, some class
attribute and method local array types were being parsed to
unnecessarily include '[' characters.

- When parsing source files, leading spaces are now parsed properly for
package names, imports, and class declarations.

Many thanks to Eric Lafortune for spotting these bugs, submitting tests,
and significantly contributing to the fixes!

The JDepend documentation is available at

http://www.clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html

JDepend 2.1 can be downloaded directly from

http://www.clarkware.com/software/jdepend2.1.zip

By the way, Jerome Lacoste has contributed a JDepend Ant task to the Ant
development team. It's currently available by downloading a nightly Ant
build and should be available in the next official Ant release.

As always, any feedback you may have is most welcome and appreciated.

Thanks and enjoy!

Mike

--
Mike Clark
Clarkware Consulting, Inc.

Development, and Performance Consulting
